articles.author: Pete Schroeder
articles.description: A ransomware attack on Industrial and Commercial Bank of China (ICBC) disrupted some trades in the U.S. Treasury market on Thursday, the Treasury Department said.
articles.title: Ransomware attack on China's ICBC disrupts Treasury market trades

articles.author: Stephen Nellis
articles.description: Humane, a Silicon Valley startup with a star-studded list of co-founders and executives, on Thursday released a $699 device that aims to bring cutting-edge artificial intelligence to a lapel near you.
articles.title: Wearable 'Ai Pin' launched by Humane, backed by ex-Apple execs and Microsoft

articles.author: Vidya Ranganathan, Lawrence White
articles.description: LSEG Chief Executive Officer David Schwimmer said the market for Initial Public Offerings (IPOs) in London and elsewhere around the world should recover from current lows caused by concerns about rising interest rates and geopolitical and economic instability.
articles.title: LSEG chief Schwimmer: IPOs to return 'when the environment stabilises'

articles.author: William Schomberg, Andy Bruce
articles.description: Britain's stagnating economy failed to grow in the July-to-September period but at least managed to avoid the start of a recession, figures from the Office for National Statistics showed on Friday.
articles.title: UK economy fails to grow but sidesteps start of a recession

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Novo Nordisk (NOVOb.CO) said on Friday it plans to invest more than 42 billion crowns ($6 billion) in the coming years as it seeks to meet booming demand for its Wegovy weight-loss treatment and other drugs.
articles.title: Weight-loss drug maker Novo Nordisk to invest $6 bln in expanding plant

articles.author: Tom Polansek
articles.description: The United States is importing record amounts of beef this year and exporting less after ranchers slashed the nation's cattle herd to its lowest level in decades, tightening margins for meat companies like Tyson Foods (TSN.N).
articles.title: US reduces beef exports as cattle herd shrinks, squeezing Tyson Foods

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Steve Holland
articles.description: Gaza officials said Israel launched air strikes on or near at least three hospitals on Friday, further stressing the Palestinian enclave's precarious health system as it struggles to cope with thousands of people wounded or displaced in Israel's war against Hamas militants.
articles.title: Gaza officials say hospitals come under new Israeli attacks

articles.author: Yu Xie
articles.description: China's embattled Country Garden (2007.HK) is aiming to pull together a tentative plan to restructure its offshore debt by the end of this year, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Country Garden aims to have offshore debt restructuring plan by year end

articles.author: Poppy Mcpherson, Devjyot Ghoshal
articles.description: A rebel alliance has overrun parts of northern Myanmar, including areas bordering China, with resistance to the military junta notching its most significant win since the 2021 coup, according to a rebel commander, diplomats and analysts.
articles.title: Losing ground to rebel alliance, Myanmar junta faces biggest test since coup
